0. What is an Algorithm?.title: What is an Algorithm?
0. What is an Algorithm?.content: A set of instructions that can be executed to accomplish a specific task or to produce a result. A process durer for solving a problem is called an algorithm.

1. What is Big O notation?.title: What is Big O notation?
1. What is Big O notation?.content: Big O Notation is a way to measure an algorithm's efficiency. It measures the time it takes to run your function as the input grows.

2. What is meant by linear search?.title: What is meant by linear search?
2. What is meant by linear search?.section: 2. What is meant by linear search?

3. What is o(n) time complexity.title: what is o(n) time complexity

4. What does n represent in big O?.title: What will happen as n approaches infinity in BigO?
4. What does n represent in big O?.content: Big O notation is written in the form of O(n) where O stands for “order of magnitude” and n represents what we're comparing the complexity of a task against.
4. What does n represent in big O?.section: 4. What does n represent in big O?

6. What does space complexity mean?.title: What does space complexity mean?

7. What is space complexity types?.title: What is space complexity types?
7. What is space complexity types?.content:
Space complexity types are used to describe the amount of space required to store a given data structure.

### Space complexity types

- **O(1)**: Constant time complexity.
- **O(n)**: Linear time complexity.
- **O(log n)**: Logarithmic time complexity.

8. What is the fastest big O?.title: What is the fastest big O?
8. What is the fastest big O?.content:
The fastest possible running time for any algorithm is O(1), commonly referred to as Constant Running Time. In this case, the algorithm always takes the same amount of time to execute, regardless of the input size.

**Example of Constant Running Time:**

```javascript
function constantRunningTime(n) {
	return n
}

constantRunningTime(1) // O(1)
```

The above algorithm is the fastest possible running time for any algorithm. It always takes the same amount of time to execute, regardless of the input size.
8. What is the fastest big O?.section: 8. What is the fastest big O?

What is binary searching?.title: What is binary searching?

When should you not use binary search?.title: When should you not use binary search?
When should you not use binary search?.content: In case the list of elements is not sorted, there's no way to use binary search because the median value of the list can be anywhere and when the list is split into two parts, the element that you were searching for could be cut off. This is why binary search is not useful.
When should you not use binary search?.section: When should you not use binary search?
